column4: python-setuptools is giving me trouble:  easy_install --prefix /usr/local pyrocore gets me an error message: TEST FAILED: /usr/local/lib/python2.6/site-packages does NOT support .pth files error: bad install directory or PYTHONPATH... running this under root
any ide where PYTHONPATH should point to?
I'm not sure, did apt-get install python
trying to install pyrocore, by following their instructions
what version of Ubuntu are you on?
make sure you read every part of that section
sorry trying to look it up, I'm newb at this :|
If easy_install prints a message containing error: bad install directory or PYTHONPATH, try to use --prefix /usr in the above command.
easy_install --prefix /usr pyrocore  -> error: installation into /usr  ->Trying to install into the system managed parts of the file system.
do you at least have an idea what PYTHONPATH is for? is it a lib dir or an install dir?
I've never dealt with it, perhaps #python would know
